sentences.en: A stand of magnificent ghost gums with pallid white trunks and drifting thin leaves.
sentences.cn: 一片壮丽的橡胶树林,有着苍白的树干和依稀的树叶.

sentences.en: After being sick in bed for a week, Jane still looked pallid.
sentences.cn: 卧病在床一星期后, 简的脸色看起来仍然有些苍白.

sentences.en: At its best, it makes standard English seem pallid.
sentences.cn: 往最好了说它让标准英语显得苍白.

sentences.en: Crass's fat face was pallid with fear as he clung tremblingly to his seat.
sentences.cn: 克拉斯死抱着座位发抖,他那肥胖的脸吓得铁青.

sentences.en: Frozen tissues are painless and appear waxy with a pallid yellow color.
sentences.cn: 冻伤的组织是不痛的,看起来象淡黄颜色的蜡一样.

sentences.en: Her siege of illness left her languid and pallid.
sentences.cn: 疾病的长期折磨把她弄得倦怠不堪,毫无生气.

sentences.en: His dry pallid face often looked gaunt.
sentences.cn: 他那张干瘪苍白的脸常常显得憔悴.

sentences.en: On her pallid cheek and forehead came a colour and a light.
sentences.cn: 她苍白的脸颊和前额染上颜色并散发出光彩.

sentences.en: People prefer that I look pretty, not a pallid white.
sentences.cn: 人们喜欢我看起来漂漂亮亮的, 不喜欢我煞白的模样.

sentences.en: Some excerpts from a Renaissance mass are spatchcocked into Gluck's pallid Don Juan music.
sentences.cn: 一些文艺复光时期的弥撒的选节被不适当地加入到了格鲁克平淡无味的唐璜音乐中.

sentences.en: The lamp overhead gave out a pallid glow , shining dimly on my face, still half asleep.
sentences.cn: 头上的电灯洒一些淡黄的光在我的惺忪的脸上.

sentences.en: The moon drifted from behind the clouds and exposed the pallid face.
sentences.cn: 月亮从云朵后面钻出来,照着尸体那张苍白的脸.

sentences.en: Their condition ranged from pallid shock to profane defiance.
sentences.cn: 有的吓得脸无人色,有的天不怕地不怕.

sentences.en: You look a bit pallid do you feel all right?
sentences.cn: 你脸色有点苍白--你没事儿吧?

words.tran_cn: 苍白（尤指脸色）；青白；灰白
苍白的；暗淡的；无生气的

trans.tran_cn: 苍白的，病态的，无生气的，煞白
trans.tran_en: very pale, especially in a way that looks weak or unhealthy
